title: User Management Admin UI
description:
Create Comprehensive Admin Interface for User Management

Build a complete administrative interface that enables authorized administrators to manage users, assign roles, and configure granular permissions across the system.

Requirements:

User Management Features:
- Display paginated, searchable, and filterable list of all users
- Enable viewing detailed user profiles including account status, creation date, and activity history
- Provide ability to create, edit, and deactivate/delete user accounts
- Support bulk operations (e.g., bulk role assignment, bulk status changes)
- Include user search by username, email, or other identifying attributes

Role Assignment:
- Display available roles with clear descriptions of their purpose
- Allow assigning single or multiple roles to users
- Show current role assignments for each user
- Enable adding new roles and editing existing role definitions
- Provide role hierarchy or inheritance if applicable

Permission Configuration:
- Present granular permissions organized by feature/module
- Allow configuring which permissions are included in each role
- Support direct user-level permission overrides when needed
- Implement permission templates for common access patterns
- Display effective permissions for users (combined from roles and overrides)

Security & Access Control:
- Restrict admin interface access to users with admin privileges
- Implement audit logging for all user management actions
- Require confirmation for destructive operations (delete, revoke critical permissions)
- Validate permission changes don't lock out all administrators

User Experience:
- Design intuitive navigation between user list, role management, and permission settings
- Provide clear visual feedback for permission states (granted/denied/inherited)
- Include help text explaining what each permission controls
- Ensure responsive design for various screen sizes

Technical Considerations:
- Determine data model for users, roles, and permissions
- Implement backend API endpoints for CRUD operations
- Add proper authorization checks on all admin endpoints
- Consider caching strategy for permission lookups
- Plan database indexes for efficient user searching and filtering
